channel.title: Research Projects on Chiara Zuanni
channel.description: Recent content in Research Projects on Chiara Zuanni

item.title: Liverpool 2018: Legacies of the European Capital of Culture 10 Years On
item.description: The project “Impacts18” aimed to observe the long-term impact of the European Capital of Culture award on the city of Liverpool. In my role, I conducted press and social media data analysis; archival analysis in the City of Liverpool, and contributed to the preparation of interviews with key stakeholders, to the organisation of workshops, and to presentations.

item.title: Shakespeare Lives - Monitoring & Evaluation
item.description: I contributed to the writing of the funding application, and to the design and delivery of the research. I conducted press analysis (in English and Russian; and trained Chinese students in content analysis for Chinese news items) and contributed to social media analysis and to the preparation of interviews with key stakeholders.

item.title: Universal Histories and Universal Museums
item.description: The project aimed to develop a comparative critique of approaches to universal histories in museums and of the role of museums in building knowledge about the future. I was the postdoctoral researcher on the project and I was therefore responsible of archival research (in London and Paris), co-organisation of the four workshops, development of the project website and its digital exhibition.

tasks and short description slug: ‘/2018_AncIt’ title: ‘Getty Institute in Ancient Itineraries (2018-2019)’ shortTitle: ‘Ancient Itineraries’ date: “2018-06-01” tags: [“semantic web”] categories: [“Project”] statuses: [“completedLead”] Getty Institute in Ancient Itineraries (2018-2019) Role: Member PIs: Dr Stuart Dunn (KCL), Prof Graeme Earl (KCL), Dr Arianna Ciula (KCL), Dr Will Wootton (KCL); Dr Anna Foka (University of Uppsala) Funding: Getty Foundation Description: The project sought to investigate the potential and impact of ‘digital’, and in particular linked open data, on art history research.

tasks and short description slug: ‘/CuratingBornDigital’ title: ‘Curating Digital Data in Museums - workshop (2019)’ shortTitle: ‘…’ tags: [“contemporary collecting”] categories: [“Project”] statuses: [“completedLead”] date: “2019-02-02” Curating Digital Data in Museums - workshop (2019) Role: PI Funding: ca. € 4000 (Faculty of Humanities, University of Graz) Description: A workshop with international speakers on the topic of born-digital collections in museums. The event examined new curating practices emerging in response to the collecting and archiving of born-digital data; responses to the coexistence of physical and digital heritage in museum collections and displays; methodological issues raised by the acquisition of born-digital (big) data (including current research on collection management systems and metadata for this content); ethical and legal questions concerning the use of this data.

tasks and short description slug: ‘/other’ title: ‘INTERREG Danubes Archaeological eLandscapes’ tags: [“semantic web”] categories: [“Project”] statuses: [“ongoing”] date: “2019-01-01” Contributor (UniGraz being associate member) to the EU INTERREG Danubes Archaeological eLandscapes (2020-2023, led by Universalmuseum Joanneum Archaeology): contributing to social archaeology strand, with a focus on digital public archaeology.

tasks and short description slug: ‘/DariahTheme’ title: ‘Contemporary collecting and COVID-19: barriers, bottlenecks, and perspectives in digital curation (2020-2021 - DARIAH Theme)’ shortTitle: ‘…’ tags: [“COVID-19”, “contemporary collecting”] categories: [“Project”] statuses: [“ongoing”] date: “2020-11-11” Contemporary collecting and COVID-19: barriers, bottlenecks, and perspectives in digital curation (2020-2021 - DARIAH Theme) Role: PI Funding: € 8670,00 Description: The project aims to survey collections of memories and witnesses of the pandemic, identifying the processes and challenges encountered by memory organisations in dealing with such contemporary and (often) born-digital material.

tasks and short description slug: ‘/DigiCulture’ title: ‘DigitalCulture. Improving the Digital Competences and Social Inclusion of Adults in Creative Industries (2018-2021 - Erasmus+)’ tags: [“skills”] categories: [“Project”] statuses: [“completedLead”] date: “2018-01-10” DigitalCulture. Improving the Digital Competences and Social Inclusion of Adults in Creative Industries (2018-2021 - Erasmus+) Role: Local PI. Partners: Polytechnic of Timisoara (coordinator - Romania), University of Roma Tre (Italy), University of Aalborg (Denmark), Dublin City University (Ireland), Fundaţia Interart TRIADE (Romania), JME Associates Ltd (UK), National Association of Distance Education (Lithuania).

tasks and short description slug: ‘/Gipsmuseum’ title: ‘Virtual Gipsmuseum (work-package within DiTAH)’ tags: [“semantic web”] categories: [“Project”] statuses: [“ongoing”] date: “2020-09-09” Virtual Gipsmuseum (work-package within DiTAH) Role: co-I of this workpackage (2020-2021), within the flagship project DiTAH led by Prof Georg Vogeler (BMBWF funding, 2020-2024) Partners for the work-package: Dr Elisabeth Trinkl - Institute of Archaeology, University of Graz Funding: ca. € 26.000,00 Description: The project is using LiDAR scans and photogrammetry to create a virtual museum of the cast collection (Gipsmuseum) of the department of archaeology.

tasks and short description slug: ‘/Habil’ title: ‘Habilitation’ tags: [“contemporary collecting”, “audience research”] categories: [“Project”] statuses: [“ongoing”] date: “2018-01-05” Habilitation I am writing my Habilitation (a requirement for tenure in the Austrian system) on data practices in museums, with a focus on social media data and contemporary collecting.

tasks and short description slug: ‘/HFDTeducation’ title: ‘Museum Digital Materials and Online Learning during the Pandemic​ (2020-2021 - HFDT funding)’ tags: [“skills”, “COVID-19”, “audience research”] categories: [“Project”] statuses: [“completedLead”] date: “2020-10-10” Museum Digital Materials and Online Learning during the Pandemic​ (2020-2021 - HFDT funding) Role: co-I Partners: Prof Kathrin Otrel-Cass (Institute of Education Research and Teacher Education, University of Graz) Funding: € 9816,00 Description: This small project aims to research the use of museum digital material in school programmes during the COVID-19 pandemic.

tasks and short description slug: ‘/MuseumsCovid’ title: ‘Map of museum digital initiatives during the COVID-19 pandemic’ tags: [“COVID-19”] categories: [“Project”] statuses: [“ongoing”] date: “2020-06-06” Map of museum digital initiatives during the COVID-19 pandemic (not funded) I developed a map aiming to collect and present the range of digital projects promoted and launched by museums since March 2020. Project assistant: Sabrina Melcher Link: https://digitalmuseums.at

tasks and short description slug: ‘/ReInHerit’ title: ‘Redefining the Future of Culture Heritage, through a disruptive model of sustainability (2021-2024 - H2020)’ tags: [“skills”] categories: [“Project”] statuses: [“ongoing”] date: “2021-03-03” Redefining the Future of Culture Heritage, through a disruptive model of sustainability (2021-2024 - H2020) Role: Local PI and WP leader. Partners: Bank of Cyprus Cultural Foundation (coordinator - Cyprus), Museum of Cycladic Art (Greece), CYENS Centre of Excellence (Cyprus), UNIC - School of Law (Cyprus), materahub (Italy), Arte Sostenible (Spain), Media Integration and Communication Center - University of Florence (Italy), Graz Museum (Austria), ECTN - European Cultural Tourism Network (Belgium), Arcada - University of Applied Sciences (Finland), Hellenic Committee of the Blue Shield (Greece).

tasks and short description slug: ‘/seadda’ title: ‘COST Action SEADDA’ tags: [“semantic web”] categories: [“Project”] statuses: [“completedLead”] date: “2019-01-01” Substitute member in Management Committee for the COST Action SEADDA (2019-2023)

item.title: Campus Obscurus
item.description: The project, part of a larger research programme by the PIs, focused on the development of a social media-based treasure hunt around the University of Manchester campus and Manchester cultural institutions, to engage students. My tasks included the preparation of the event (maps; hints; dissemination of QR codes and material for the “hunt”), supporting it (monitoring relevant social media channels and hashtags), and contributing to data collection for its evaluation and reporting.

item.title: Culture Metrics
item.description: I contributed to the project by conducting literature reviews (on metrics in the cultural sector and in higher education), support in organising and delivering a workshop, social media data research.

item.title: CultureFM
item.description: CultureFM explored different ways of using and interacting over Twitter, researching how these different ways of communicatoin could enhance digital engagement with arts organisations. As a research assistant, I did a review of existing Twitter analysis tools and methods; I supported the events (dissemination and technical support during the streams); and I contributed to collect and analyse data about the engagement generated.

item.title: Database of British auction catalogues of Chinese objects
item.description: I prepared a database and tables transcribing catalogues of British auctions, in support of Dr Tythacott’s research.

item.title: Exhibition "Scripting the Globe. Italian Literary Journals in the World. 1945-1962"
item.description: Co-curator of this temporary exhibition at the International Anthony Burgess Foundation.

item.title: mynightmuseum participatory digital game
item.description: mynightmuseum was a social media (mainly Twitter) event during Museums at Night. My role included supporting the Twitter event, and collecting and analysising the Twitter data afterwards.

item.title: Public Engagement with the Museum of Medicine and Health
item.description: Preparation of a social media campaign across platforms; analytics; and contribution to an event at Manchester Histories Festival.

item.title: Social Media Strategy and Analytics work
item.description: I have supported the Kipling Society in developing a social media strategy; and I have developed social media analytics and evaluation reports for the Manchester Histories Festival and the School of Arts, Languages, and Cultures (University of Manchester). Besides, I have managed social media for a range of project and event accounts, as well as for some student engagement campaigns at the Institute for Cultural Practices (University of Manchester).
